data.description:
Create high energy encounters with Naer ‚Äì the Mixed Reality productivity app where colleagues collaborate in a truly hybrid, immersive workplace.

Set the timer and share ideas as fast as you can express them with telekinetic sticky notes. Your work merges directly into Miro, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about documentation.

Wherever you are, gather your team in one place, for fun, fast and intuitive workshops. 

Stuff you can do in Naer
- Mixed Reality for co-located and hybrid workshops
- Talk to your sticky notes (no need for a keyboard, they‚Äôll listen)
- Integrate with Miro in realtime
- Share your computer screen
- Be fast with telekinetic superpowers
- Smooth vector drawing
- Keep track with a workshop timer
- Adjust the time of day to set the mood
- Bring your Meta Avatar

changelog.change_log:
üöÄ Introducing Naer 1.2.0!

üè¢ Standup Room Unlocked!
Stig and Antonis have gone above and beyond to standups fun, fast and focused. Welcome to our new Standup Room, perfect for standups and more 'ordinary' meetings (though nothing here is ordinary)! This room features:

First-of-its-kind Expandable Table: The table dynamically expands to the number of participants, offering a comfortable and adaptable space for any size meeting.
Break-out Zones: Dive into focused discussions with new breakout zones.
Hot Potato: Enjoy a fun and interactive way to share the speaking floor during meetings.

üåê Brand New Web App!
Ingrid has worked hard to bring you a completely revamped web app experience. Built from the ground up, it‚Äôs now faster, more intuitive, and loaded with exciting new features.

Check it out on: https://app.naer.io/

üì± Join from Phone!
We understand that sometimes you‚Äôre on the go or don‚Äôt have your headset handy, especially during your everyday standup. Thus, you can join a session from our web app using your phone! When you join, you‚Äôll appear in VR as a phone (which we think is hilarious). Check it out by creating a Standup room and join it from the web app.

Make sure you join our community to talk to other Naerians, give feedback or submit feature-requests!

Community: https://discord.gg/hYSNnBtE

*Pshh pshh (sound of spray can)*

Hi there!

Whether you‚Äôre Frida Kahlo or Edvard Munch, we‚Äôve got you covered. Now, your spray can include as many colors as the sticky notes! That means you can go completely bananas and let out your inner artist (or create some really nice SWOT-diagrams) - Thanks Antonis! 

After we made it so that you can create rooms directly from VR, we realized (after loving our own feature a bit too much) that it can become a bit messy with all the ‚ÄúWorkshop Rooms‚Äùs. Thanks to Ingrid, every new room now includes a numerical suffix to keep things organized. Furthermore, Stig has implemented a highly requested feature that allows you to delete rooms directly from the lobby. Pew pew to those old rooms you don't need anymore.

Speaking of Stig, he has also made the ability to share your screen even more performant. Did you know that you can use the screen share feature to cast some really nice tunes into Naer? 100% Cave-rave approved.

Major release incoming!

First of all - Naer is now free to use for individuals and teams! 

For new people checking out Naer, you‚Äôll be greeted with a brand-new tutorial. Thanks to 
Antonis, it is now much clearer what you need to do, and how the app works! Interacting in Naer has also become even smoother with our latest improvements to telekinesis.

We also welcome you to a new lobby with crisp panels and the ability to create rooms without taking off your headset! Sharing a headset? No problem, you can change the name of your avatar and your appearance right from the lobby. You even get faster into the room you visited last time because now it‚Äôs right at the top of the list! Nice one, Stig.

Thanks to our Keeper of Keys, Ingrid, you can now create room codes to share with others! The room codes remove the need for pairing headsets or being a part of a team to join a session in VR. Neat. She has also done a lot of things you don‚Äôt see, working in the shadows (like Batman).

Fixes & Improvements 
No more accidental muting of other participants! Antonis and Bengt Ove made it harder to mute others by mistake and also made improvements to the look and feel of the name tags. You now see who‚Äôs talking, and who is muted.  

Telekinesis is actually super hard to do well. Antonis has worked his a** off to provide you with better aiming, better animations, and better push and pull of content between you and the whiteboard. Based on where you look, we can now detect a whiteboard and understand if you intend to send the sticky note to the whiteboard or if you wish to delete it. It‚Äôs actually quite magical and even more natural to use. Try to look at the whiteboard while holding a sticky note and flicking your wrist like a wand and see for yourself!

Want to listen to some sweet tunes in Naer? Stig has improved the audio quality of the screen share stream, so feel free to host your very own cave rave. When sharing your computer screen in Naer, the screen size will also adapt to the content you are sharing - cool right? Lastly, we have moved the screen to the left side of the whiteboard so you don‚Äôt lose any of the whiteboard content when sharing your screen.

Lastly we fixed a rare issue where people could get disconnected for no good reason.

Bengt Ove rewrote pretty much our whole Miro integration from scratch, making sure it exceeds your expectations. It‚Äôs much more stable than before adding support for images, plain text, many shapes, and of course the humble sticky note.

Also, now might be a good time to beam your computer screen into Naer! 
Stig has made screen sharing much more reliable, and updated our dependencies to the latest and greatest to ensure we‚Äôre using their latest and most bug free features. And, if you enable screen sharing in VR before casting from the web app, Bengt Ove added some instructions on how to cast your screen. 

Lastly, Antonis has made improvements to super powers like telekinetic pulling, making it feel much more natural (really, try it. thank him later). Learning how to use Naer is now also easier since we have added videos to the tutorial, along with the already brilliant voice over. We also thought to align that mirror a bit better (mirror mirror on the wall, who is the best facilitator of them all?).
